page.syntax: as P = SQL::Argument Find(Name as C)

argument.name: P
argument.description: A dot variable containing the Data, Name, and Usage properties of the object.

argument.name: Name
argument.description: The name property of the argument as defined by SQL::Arguments.Add() or SQL::Argument.Set().

page.description: Find an argument in the collection.
page.discussion: The .Find() method returns information about a defined argument.
page.example: dim args as SQL::Arguments args.add("city", "Boston") args.add("state", "MA") ? args.Find("state") = Data = "MA" Name = "state" Usage = 0 ? args.Find("state").data = "MA"
